page.title: 01Scottish Borders Hills
page.content: This is a sparsely populated hilly agricultural area. with one river 'Ale Water' running through it. No towns or villages occur from good grassland at river levels the hills rise to 900 ft where rougher grasslands occur. There are four major farms in the area one farm has a dairy herd of about 80 cows, the other farms concentrate on sheep and hill cattle. Most people are employed on the farms. A few work in small towns some 5 miles distant. Some old established deciduous woods remain. New conifer woods are planted on higher ground. Some cereals and root crops are grown Entertainment is found in nearby towns and vilages. Most people have cars although buses run on a nearby trunk road
